description: Users may notice unauthorized changes in system settings or configurations due to newly installed applications that exploit the Microsoft Speech Application Programming Interface (SAPI) elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified in CVE-2023-36719. Affected systems may experience unusual behavior when executing applications crafted to leverage this vulnerability, potentially leading to unauthorized access and control by malicious applications. This issue affects multiple Windows builds, including versions 10.0.22631.2715, 10.0.19045.3693, and 10.0.10240.20308, and is addressed in various KB articles including KB-5032199, KB-5032192, KB-5032190, and KB-5032189.
